uobHMode.name: uobHMode
uobHMode.description: The mode of the data collection. Valid values are: daily or longterm.

uobHNumEvents.name: uobHNumEvents
uobHNumEvents.description: Total number of all traps (events) generated by all UOB modules.

uobHHistTable.name: uobHHistTable
uobHHistTable.description: This table represents the information for performance data collected for each UOB module

uobHHistEntry.name: uobHHistEntry
uobHHistEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

uobHHistMode.name: uobHHistMode
uobHHistMode.description: The mode of the data collection. Valid values are: daily or longterm.

uobHHistLocation.name: uobHHistLocation
uobHHistLocation.description: The location of the module. Choices are local or remote.

uobHHistShelf.name: uobHHistShelf
uobHHistShelf.description: The shelf the module is in.

uobHHistSlot.name: uobHHistSlot
uobHHistSlot.description: The slot within the shelf the module is in.

uobHLastBootTime.name: uobHLastBootTime
uobHLastBootTime.description: The date and time of the last boot for this module.

uobHAvailTime.name: uobHAvailTime
uobHAvailTime.description: The number of seconds that this module has been up and running.

uobHErrFreeSecs.name: uobHErrFreeSecs
uobHErrFreeSecs.description: The number of seconds that this module has not experienced any alarms.

fc8gNumEvents.name: fc8gNumEvents
fc8gNumEvents.description: Total number of all traps (events) generated by all FC8G modules in this time slot (15 minutes).

fc8gPerfTable.name: fc8gPerfTable
fc8gPerfTable.description: This table represents the information for performance data collected for each FC8G module.

fc8gPerfEntry.name: fc8gPerfEntry
fc8gPerfEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

fc8gPerfLocation.name: fc8gPerfLocation
fc8gPerfLocation.description: The location of the module. Choices are local or remote.

fc8gPerfShelf.name: fc8gPerfShelf
fc8gPerfShelf.description: The shelf the module is in.

fc8gPerfSlot.name: fc8gPerfSlot
fc8gPerfSlot.description: The slot within the shelf the module is in.

fc8gPerfState.name: fc8gPerfState
fc8gPerfState.description: The state of the FC8G module. The states are: online, offline, empty or loopback.

fc8gPerfStatus.name: fc8gPerfStatus
fc8gPerfStatus.description: The status of the FC8G module. This status represents the status of the FC8G module and in general is different from the status of the system.

fc8gLastBootTime.name: fc8gLastBootTime
fc8gLastBootTime.description: The date and time of the last boot for this module.

fc8gAvailTime.name: fc8gAvailTime
fc8gAvailTime.description: The number of seconds in this time slot (15 minutes) that this module has been up and running. This will generally be the same as 15 minutes in seconds (900).

fc8gErrFreeSecs.name: fc8gErrFreeSecs
fc8gErrFreeSecs.description: The number of seconds in this time slot (15 minutes) that this module has not experienced any alarms.

sysAddCard.name: sysAddCard
sysAddCard.description: Add card operation given type, shelf, slot, and optionally sub card type. The format is (type,shelf, slot[,optional]). If the fourth optional parameter is present, for OCMITU/OCMU, its value should be 1 to indicate OCMITU/OCMU with CSIM; for MCMESC, its value should be 0 or 1 to indicate MPM will not overide or will override the settings stored on MCMESC upon detecting it. Different types of card: OCMU: 2 //with or without csim module OCMI: 3 //with or without csim module OFCM: 4 OFCD: 5 FADM: 6 MCMT1: 8 W4CD: 10 W2CM/D: 13 OSAM: 20 W4CM: 21 RSM: 22 UPSM: 23 OCME: 24 OCM10G: 27 OSAM-LP: 29 OSAM-HP: 30 MCMESC: 33 WFADM: 34 MCME1: 35 MD100-1: 36 MD100-40: 37 TAP: 38 MD100-5 39 MD100-10 40 OCM10GLR 41 BD-4 42 BP-10 43 DMM 45 BP-5 46 OSC 48 OCM2 49 OCM10GF 50 OCM2-4G 51 OET 52 UOB 53 FC8G 54 MD100P 55 CWDM-BD4 56 For example, to add a FADM card in shelf 1, slot 8, this variable will be set to 6,1,8. To add an OCMI card with colorsim module in shelf 1, slot 7, this variable will be set to 3,1,7,1. To add an MCMESC card with override option in shelf 1, slot 7, this variable will be set to 33,1,7,1. A get on this will return 0,0,0,0

sysAlarmCtrl.name: sysAlarmCtrl
sysAlarmCtrl.description: The Master Control for Alarms. Will enable or disable all external and visual alarms of the system. The default state is enable.

sysAlarmCritical.name: sysAlarmCritical
sysAlarmCritical.description: Turns on or off all external critical audible and visual alarms.

sysAlarmMajor.name: sysAlarmMajor
sysAlarmMajor.description: Turns on or off all external major and minor audible and visual alarms.

sysAlarmSerial.name: sysAlarmSerial
sysAlarmSerial.description: Enables or disables the flow of TL1 alarms to the serial port.

sysAlarmAutoCutoff.name: sysAlarmAutoCutoff
sysAlarmAutoCutoff.description: Enables or disables the AutoCutoff feature for dry-contact alarm closures

sysAddRoute.name: sysAddRoute
sysAddRoute.description: Add route operation given local shelf, local slot, destination IP address and route Type. The format is (shelf, slot, route Type, destination IP). Different types of route types are: external Route: 1 (Route to an external non LuxN node) internal Route: 2 (Route to a LuxN node in the network) For example, to add an internal route to a LuxN node with IP address 192.162.6.65 from local shelf 1, slot 6 this variable would be set to 1,6,3,192.162.6.65 For adding an external route, shelf & slot needs to be zero. For e.g To add an external route to destination address 192.168.9.99, this variable needs to be set to 0,0,192.168.9.99 A get on this will return 0,0,0,0 NO LONGER SUPPORTED, user now needs to use sysImnAddRoute

sysDeleteRoute.name: sysDeleteRoute
sysDeleteRoute.description: Delete route operation given local shelf, local slot & destination IP address . The format is (shelf, slot, destination IP). For example, to delete a route to a LuxN node with IP address 192.162.6.65 from local shelf 1, slot 6 this variable would be set to 1,6,192.162.6.65 A get on this will return 0,0,0 NO LONGER SUPPORTED, user now needs to use sysImnAddRoute

sysSwitchByPathId.name: sysSwitchByPathId
sysSwitchByPathId.description: Initiate UPSR switching by Path ID.

sysSwitchAll.name: sysSwitchAll
sysSwitchAll.description: Switch all CC cards that have backup.

sysAlarmMinor.name: sysAlarmMinor
sysAlarmMinor.description: Turns on or off all external minor audible and visual alarms.

sysDelCfgDb.name: sysDelCfgDb
sysDelCfgDb.description: Action to delete configuration database. MPM would reboot after the database is deleted. A get on it will return other

sysImnAddRoute.name: sysImnAddRoute
sysImnAddRoute.description: Add route operation. It takes destination IP address, IP mask and the route metric. The format is (destination IP, IP mask, routeMetric). A get on this will return 0.0.0.0,0.0.0.0,0

sysImnDeleteRoute.name: sysImnDeleteRoute
sysImnDeleteRoute.description: Delete route operation. It takes destination IP address and IP mask. The format is (destination IP, IP mask=). A get on this will return 0.0.0.0,0.0.0.0

sysExtAlarmInputTable.name: sysExtAlarmInputTable
sysExtAlarmInputTable.description: This table represents the input information for each external alarm indicator

sysExtAlarmInputEntry.name: sysExtAlarmInputEntry
sysExtAlarmInputEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

sysExtAlarmInputId.name: sysExtAlarmInputId
sysExtAlarmInputId.description: Id of an external alarm indicator. Valid values are: 1 to 6

sysExtAlarmInput.name: sysExtAlarmInput
sysExtAlarmInput.description: Configurable value for an external alarm indicator. Default value is off. For the chassis with old sensor board, the value is na and is not settable.

sysExtAlarmInputName.name: sysExtAlarmInputName
sysExtAlarmInputName.description: User configurable name for an external alarm input indicator. For the chassis with old sensor board, the value is na and is not settable.

sysAudioAlarm.name: sysAudioAlarm
sysAudioAlarm.description: Mode for audio alarm. Default is off. For non-carrier-class chassis, it is na

sysAudioAlarmSeverity.name: sysAudioAlarmSeverity
sysAudioAlarmSeverity.description: Controls for audio alarm. When the control is set to minor, it will go off for all minor and up alarms. Default is major. For non-carrier-class chassis, it is na. These control only make sense for audio alarm in brief or continous mode

sysRdbcopy.name: sysRdbcopy
sysRdbcopy.description: Forces a database copy to the standby MPM. Reading this element will always return 'other'. This element can only be set to 'copydb'. If the standby MPM is present then a database copy will be initiated, otherwise an error will be return.

sysRdbcopyStatus.name: sysRdbcopyStatus
sysRdbcopyStatus.description: Displays the percentage done for forced database copies. No value is returned if a forced database copy is not in progress.

sysSDMRequestsQueued.name: sysSDMRequestsQueued
sysSDMRequestsQueued.description: Displays the number of requests in the SDM queue.

sysModuleupdateJobsWaiting.name: sysModuleupdateJobsWaiting
sysModuleupdateJobsWaiting.description: Displays the number of module updates jobs from the current request that must wait until one or more of the jobs progressing completes. This element will only be returned if one or more module update jobs are in progress.

sysModuleupdateJobsTable.name: sysModuleupdateJobsTable
sysModuleupdateJobsTable.description: This table defines the module update jobs in progress. Table entries will only be reutrned if one for more module update jobs are in progress.

sysModuleupdateJobsEntry.name: sysModuleupdateJobsEntry
sysModuleupdateJobsEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

sysModupdShelf.name: sysModupdShelf
sysModupdShelf.description: Shelf of the module being updated. For remote updates this will be the shelf of the local module through the update occurs.

sysModupdSlot.name: sysModupdSlot
sysModupdSlot.description: Slot of the module being updated. For remote updates this will be the slot of the local module through the update occurs.

sysModupdLocation.name: sysModupdLocation
sysModupdLocation.description: Location (local or remote) of the module being updated

sysModupdRmtStation.name: sysModupdRmtStation
sysModupdRmtStation.description: Remote station of the module being updated

sysSNMPKeepaliveEnable.name: sysSNMPKeepaliveEnable
sysSNMPKeepaliveEnable.description: Enable or disable SNMP keep alive functionality.

sysSNMPKeepaliveInterval.name: sysSNMPKeepaliveInterval
sysSNMPKeepaliveInterval.description: Set the SNMP keep alive interval in minutes.

sysStatus.name: sysStatus
sysStatus.description: The global status of the system as computed based on the traps (events) that are generated. Choices are: Critical, Major, Minor or Normal.

sysClearStatus.name: sysClearStatus
sysClearStatus.description: Reset the system state to Normal. The value of reset means set the state to Normal. A get on this will always return other. Note: This element is now made not-accessible as sysStatus is now a read-only element

sysClearCounters.name: sysClearCounters
sysClearCounters.description: Reset all performance counters in this 15 minutes time interval to zero. The value of reset means to reset the counters to zero. A get on this will always return other.

sysLastBootTime.name: sysLastBootTime
sysLastBootTime.description: The date and time of the last system boot. This time represents the boot time of a CP card. It is also anonymous with the power-up cycle of the chassis.

sysAvailTime.name: sysAvailTime
sysAvailTime.description: The number of seconds in this time slot (15 minutes) that the system has been up and running. This will generally be the same as 15 minutes in seconds (900), but, if the system has been reboot in the last 15 minutes interval, then it represents the number of seconds the system has been up. The criteria for the system available time is having at least one CP running with atmost non-service affecting minor alarm system status

sysErrFreeSecs.name: sysErrFreeSecs
sysErrFreeSecs.description: The number of seconds in this time slot (15 minutes) that the device has not experienced any alarms. This counter is across all cards in the chassis. The system must be in Normal status for this counter to be incremented.

sysExhaustTemperature.name: sysExhaustTemperature
sysExhaustTemperature.description: Temperature of the Chassis. Units of dgree centigrade.

dlStatus.name: dlStatus
dlStatus.description: The global status of the download task. The download task (download to the device) is either ftp-inprogress, module update inprogrss or currently idle. Since only one download at the time is handled by the system, this flag is set to inprogress as soon as any download starts. It is reset back to idle when the download is completed. This flag is set to idle on system startup. This flag can be remotely set to idle if a previous FTP download was interrupted.

dlOkDownloads.name: dlOkDownloads
dlOkDownloads.description: The number of successful downloads in this time interval (15 minutes).

dlBadDownloads.name: dlBadDownloads
dlBadDownloads.description: The number of failed downloads in this time interval (15 minutes).

dlLongestTime.name: dlLongestTime
dlLongestTime.description: Longest time for any download, in seconds, in this time interval (15 minutes).

dlLongestSize.name: dlLongestSize
dlLongestSize.description: Longest download size for any download, in bytes, in this time interval (15 minutes).

cpNumEvents.name: cpNumEvents
cpNumEvents.description: Total number of events received by the active CP in this time slot (15 minutes).

cpTrapsSent.name: cpTrapsSent
cpTrapsSent.description: Total number of traps sent by the active CP in this time slot (15 minutes).

cpSNMPCmdsRcvd.name: cpSNMPCmdsRcvd
cpSNMPCmdsRcvd.description: Total number of SNMP commands received by the active CP in this time slot (15 minutes).

cpCounterFlag.name: cpCounterFlag
cpCounterFlag.description: Turns software counters On or Off.

cpCntrTable.name: cpCntrTable
cpCntrTable.description: This table represents the information for each entry of the software counters. It is only applicable to the active MPM card.

cpCntrEntry.name: cpCntrEntry
cpCntrEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

cpCntrShelf.name: cpCntrShelf
cpCntrShelf.description: The shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 1 to 2. The system automatically determines the right value for this entry based on the value of the current active CP card.

cpCntrSlot.name: cpCntrSlot
cpCntrSlot.description: The slot within the shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 1 to 2. The system automatically determines the right value for this entry based on the value of the current active CP card.

cpCntrType.name: cpCntrType
cpCntrType.description: The type of the software counter data in this row. The data is collected for the SPI data channels.

cpTotPktSent.name: cpTotPktSent
cpTotPktSent.description: The number of data packets sent over the given data channel.

cpTotPktRcvd.name: cpTotPktRcvd
cpTotPktRcvd.description: The number of data packets received over the given data channel.

cpBadPktRcvd.name: cpBadPktRcvd
cpBadPktRcvd.description: The number of bad data packets received over the given data channel.

cpTotBadTrans.name: cpTotBadTrans
cpTotBadTrans.description: The number of bad data transmissions over the given data channel.

cpBytesSent.name: cpBytesSent
cpBytesSent.description: Total number of bytes sent over the given data channel.

cpBytesRcvd.name: cpBytesRcvd
cpBytesRcvd.description: Total number of data bytes received over the given data channel.

cpMsgsDlvrd.name: cpMsgsDlvrd
cpMsgsDlvrd.description: The number of complete messages delivered over the given data channel.

cpBufAllocFail.name: cpBufAllocFail
cpBufAllocFail.description: Number of buffer allocation failures for the given data channel.

cpEcbAllocFail.name: cpEcbAllocFail
cpEcbAllocFail.description: Number of Event Control Block allocation failures for the given data channel.

cpClearCntrs.name: cpClearCntrs
cpClearCntrs.description: If the value is reset, all software counters for this 15 minute interval are reset to zero. A get on this will always return other

cpPerfTable.name: cpPerfTable
cpPerfTable.description: This table represents the information for performance data collected for each communication processor

cpPerfEntry.name: cpPerfEntry
cpPerfEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

cpPerfShelf.name: cpPerfShelf
cpPerfShelf.description: The shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 1 to 2

cpPerfSlot.name: cpPerfSlot
cpPerfSlot.description: The slot within the shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 1 to 3

cpPerfMode.name: cpPerfMode
cpPerfMode.description: The valid types are: active CP or standby CP

cpPerfState.name: cpPerfState
cpPerfState.description: The status of the communication card. The status' are: online, offline, empty, loopback or diagnostics.

cpPerfStatus.name: cpPerfStatus
cpPerfStatus.description: The status of the communication processor. This status represents the state of the communication processor and in general is different from the status of the system.

cpLastBootTime.name: cpLastBootTime
cpLastBootTime.description: The date and time of the last boot for this CP.

cpAvailTime.name: cpAvailTime
cpAvailTime.description: The number of seconds in this time slot (15 minutes) that this CP has been up and running. This will generally be the same as 15 minutes in seconds (900).

cpErrFreeSecs.name: cpErrFreeSecs
cpErrFreeSecs.description: The number of seconds in this time slot (15 minutes) that this CP has not experienced any alarms.

ccNumEvents.name: ccNumEvents
ccNumEvents.description: Total number of events received for all CC's in this time slot (15 minutes).

ccCntrTable.name: ccCntrTable
ccCntrTable.description: This table represents the information for each entry for the software counters.

ccCntrEntry.name: ccCntrEntry
ccCntrEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

ccCntrLocation.name: ccCntrLocation
ccCntrLocation.description: The location of the CC card. The values are: Local or Remote. The system automatically determines the right value for this entry based on the known CC cards.

ccCntrShelf.name: ccCntrShelf
ccCntrShelf.description: The shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 1 to 2. The system automatically determines the right value for this entry based on the known (available) CC cards.

ccCntrSlot.name: ccCntrSlot
ccCntrSlot.description: The slot within the shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 1 to 17. The system automatically determines the right value for this entry based on the known (available) CC cards.

ccCntrType.name: ccCntrType
ccCntrType.description: The type of the software counter data in this row. The data is collected for the SPI data channels.

ccCounterFlag.name: ccCounterFlag
ccCounterFlag.description: Turns software counters, both On or both Off for this CC. When set to Off, both counters statistic information will be cleared.

ccTotPktSent.name: ccTotPktSent
ccTotPktSent.description: The number of data packets sent over the given data channel.

ccTotPktRcvd.name: ccTotPktRcvd
ccTotPktRcvd.description: The number of data packets received over the given data channel.

ccBadPktRcvd.name: ccBadPktRcvd
ccBadPktRcvd.description: The number of bad data packets received over the given data channel.

ccTotBadTrans.name: ccTotBadTrans
ccTotBadTrans.description: The number of bad data transmissions over the given data channel.

ccBytesSent.name: ccBytesSent
ccBytesSent.description: Total number of bytes sent over the given data channel.

ccBytesRcvd.name: ccBytesRcvd
ccBytesRcvd.description: Total number of data bytes received over the given data channel.

ccMsgsDlvrd.name: ccMsgsDlvrd
ccMsgsDlvrd.description: The number of complete messages delivered over the given data channel.

ccBufAllocFail.name: ccBufAllocFail
ccBufAllocFail.description: Number of buffer allocation failures for the given data channel.

ccEcbAllocFail.name: ccEcbAllocFail
ccEcbAllocFail.description: Number of Event Control Block allocation failures for the given data channel.

ccClearCntrs.name: ccClearCntrs
ccClearCntrs.description: If the value is reset, all software counters for this 15 minute interval are reset to zero. A get on this will always return other

ccPerfTable.name: ccPerfTable
ccPerfTable.description: This table represents the information for performance data collected for each channel card

ccPerfEntry.name: ccPerfEntry
ccPerfEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

ccPerfLocation.name: ccPerfLocation
ccPerfLocation.description: The location of the card. Valid choices are Local or Remote. The system automatically selects this value based on the known (available) CC cards.

ccPerfShelf.name: ccPerfShelf
ccPerfShelf.description: The shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 1 to 10

ccPerfSlot.name: ccPerfSlot
ccPerfSlot.description: The slot within the shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 4 to 42

ccPerfState.name: ccPerfState
ccPerfState.description: The state of the channel card. The states' are: online, offline, empty, loopback or diagnostics.

ccPerfStatus.name: ccPerfStatus
ccPerfStatus.description: The status of the channel card. This status represents the status of the communication processor and in general is different from the status of the system.

ccLastBootTime.name: ccLastBootTime
ccLastBootTime.description: The date and time of the last boot for this card.

ccAvailTime.name: ccAvailTime
ccAvailTime.description: The number of seconds in this time slot (15 minutes) that this CC has been up and running. This will generally be the same as 15 minutes in seconds (900).

ccErrFreeSecs.name: ccErrFreeSecs
ccErrFreeSecs.description: The number of seconds in this time slot (15 minutes) that this CC has not experienced any alarms.

ccBiasCurrent.name: ccBiasCurrent
ccBiasCurrent.description: Bias current for the optical laser.

ccModulation.name: ccModulation
ccModulation.description: The frequency modulation for the optical laser.

ccIwmModulation.name: ccIwmModulation
ccIwmModulation.description: The frequency modulation for the IWM channel.

ccTemperature.name: ccTemperature
ccTemperature.description: The current temperature, or the operating temperature of the optical device.

ccIntensity.name: ccIntensity
ccIntensity.description: The intensity of the optical light.

ccSignalStrength.name: ccSignalStrength
ccSignalStrength.description: The current signal strength for the optical path.

ccLossOfLight.name: ccLossOfLight
ccLossOfLight.description: If set to true, no laser light is present. If set to false, no loss of light has occurred.

ccSignalDetect.name: ccSignalDetect
ccSignalDetect.description: If set to true, signal is detected. If set to false, no signal is present. Replaced with ccCpeRxSigDetect

ccRefClock.name: ccRefClock
ccRefClock.description: The value of the reference clock in decimal notation. For a given value, like 1660, the actual value is 16.60-EN. In otherwords, assume a two digit decimal point, plus any appropriate scaling factor.

ccClockDiv.name: ccClockDiv
ccClockDiv.description: The clock divisor. Values are 1250, 622 or 155 in the appropriate clock frequency scale.

ccLinkTxPwrStatus.name: ccLinkTxPwrStatus
ccLinkTxPwrStatus.description: This indicates whether the link transmit power is within the normal range of operation.

ccLinkRxSigStrStatus.name: ccLinkRxSigStrStatus
ccLinkRxSigStrStatus.description: This indicates whether the link's receive signal is within the normal range of operation.

ccCpeRxSigDetect.name: ccCpeRxSigDetect
ccCpeRxSigDetect.description: This indicates whether there is presence of CPE receive signal

ccLinkIWMStatus.name: ccLinkIWMStatus
ccLinkIWMStatus.description: This indicates the current status of IWM. This value is only applicable to remote OCMs

ccLinkSummaryStatus.name: ccLinkSummaryStatus
ccLinkSummaryStatus.description: This is the result of a logical and operation of all the individual link status. If any of the attributes is N/A, except for the local local IWM status, this value is N/A

ccProtectionMode.name: ccProtectionMode
ccProtectionMode.description: UPSR Protection Mode: active, standby and n/a.

ccLinkRxSigStr.name: ccLinkRxSigStr
ccLinkRxSigStr.description: Link's received signal strength in dBm.

muxNumEvents.name: muxNumEvents
muxNumEvents.description: Total number of all traps (events) generated by all MUX's in this time slot (15 minutes).

muxPerfTable.name: muxPerfTable
muxPerfTable.description: This table represents the information for performance data collected for each mux/demux card

muxPerfEntry.name: muxPerfEntry
muxPerfEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

muxPerfLocation.name: muxPerfLocation
muxPerfLocation.description: The location of the card. Choices are local or remote.

muxPerfShelf.name: muxPerfShelf
muxPerfShelf.description: The shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 1 to 10

muxPerfSlot.name: muxPerfSlot
muxPerfSlot.description: The slot within the shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 1 to 42

muxType.name: muxType
muxType.description: The type of the mux. The choices are: mux or demux.

muxPerfState.name: muxPerfState
muxPerfState.description: The state of the mux card. The states are: online, offline, empty, loopback or diag.

muxPerfStatus.name: muxPerfStatus
muxPerfStatus.description: The status of the mux card. This status represents the status of the mux card and in general is different from the status of the system.

muxLastBootTime.name: muxLastBootTime
muxLastBootTime.description: The date and time of the last boot for this card.

muxAvailTime.name: muxAvailTime
muxAvailTime.description: The number of seconds in this time slot (15 minutes) that this Mux has been up and running. This will generally be the same as 15 minutes in seconds (900).

muxErrFreeSecs.name: muxErrFreeSecs
muxErrFreeSecs.description: The number of seconds in this time slot (15 minutes) that this mux has not experienced any alarms.

psNumEvents.name: psNumEvents
psNumEvents.description: Total number of all traps (events) generated by all Power Supplies in this time slot (15 minutes).

psVoltageLevel3pt4Volt.name: psVoltageLevel3pt4Volt
psVoltageLevel3pt4Volt.description: Voltage Level of the 3.4 V power supply.

psVoltageLevel5pt1Volt.name: psVoltageLevel5pt1Volt

osamPerfTecCurrent.name: osamPerfTecCurrent
osamPerfTecCurrent.description: The Thermo-Electric Cooler current in mA. Not applicable to OSAM-HP/LP module

osamPerfBiasCurrent.name: osamPerfBiasCurrent
osamPerfBiasCurrent.description: The measured pump laser bias current in mA. Not applicable to OSAM-HP/LP module

osamPerfAmplifierGain.name: osamPerfAmplifierGain

osamPerfPCBTemperature.name: osamPerfPCBTemperature

osam2PerfPump1BFDPower.name: osam2PerfPump1BFDPower
osam2PerfPump1BFDPower.description: The back facet diode reading in pump 1 laser; related to the power output of the pump laser. Unit to represent the value is DAC (Digital to Analog converter)

osam2PerfPump2BFDPower.name: osam2PerfPump2BFDPower
osam2PerfPump2BFDPower.description: The back facet diode reading in pump 2 laser; related to the power output of the pump laser. Unit to represent the value is DAC (Digital to Analog converter). Applicable only for OSAM-HP module

osam2PerfPump1IBias.name: osam2PerfPump1IBias
osam2PerfPump1IBias.description: Indicates the bias current of Pump 1 in mA. The range of values of bias current range from 40 mA - barely turning on, to MaxIbias - maximum operating current recommended by the manufacturer. Pump IBias is used internally to set off alarms and to indicate the health of the module.

osam2PerfPump2IBias.name: osam2PerfPump2IBias
osam2PerfPump2IBias.description: Indicates the bias current of Pump 2 in mA. The range of values of bias current range from 40 mA - barely turning on, to MaxIbias - maximum operating current recommended by the manufacturer. Pump IBias is used internally to set off alarms and to indicate the health of the module. Applicable only for OSAM-HP module

osam2PerfPump1ITEC.name: osam2PerfPump1ITEC
osam2PerfPump1ITEC.description: Indicates the current level in mA of Thermal Electric Cooler (TEC) used for cooling laser pump 1.

osam2PerfPump2ITEC.name: osam2PerfPump2ITEC
osam2PerfPump2ITEC.description: Indicates the current level in mA of Thermal Electric Cooler (TEC) used for cooling laser pump 2. Applicable only for OSAM-HP

osam2PerfPump1Temp.name: osam2PerfPump1Temp
osam2PerfPump1Temp.description: Laser pump (#1) temperature in degree celcius

osam2PerfPump2Temp.name: osam2PerfPump2Temp
osam2PerfPump2Temp.description: Laser pump (#2) temperature in degree celcius Applicable only for OSAM-HP module

sysCStatus.name: sysCStatus
sysCStatus.description: The global status of the system as computed based on the traps (events) that are generated. Choices are: Critical, Major, Minor or Normal.

sysCSetMode.name: sysCSetMode
sysCSetMode.description: If on, the special conditions counters will be activated. These counters continue counting until the mode is off. On startup, this flag is off.

sysCAvailTime.name: sysCAvailTime
sysCAvailTime.description: The number of seconds since this mode is started that the system has been up and running. The Criteria for the system available time is having at least one CP running with atmost non-service affecting minor alarm system status

sysCErrFreeSecs.name: sysCErrFreeSecs
sysCErrFreeSecs.description: The number of seconds since this mode is started that the device has not experienced any alarms. This counter is across all cards in the chassis. The system must be in Normal status for this counter to be incremented.

dlCStatus.name: dlCStatus
dlCStatus.description: The global status of the download task. The download task (download to the device) is either ftp-inprogress, module update inprogress or currently idle. Since only one download at the time is handled by the system, this flag is set to inprogress as soon as any download starts. It is reset back to idle when the download is completed. This flag is set to idle on system startup. This flag can be remotely set to idle if a previous FTP download was interrupted.

dlCOkDownloads.name: dlCOkDownloads
dlCOkDownloads.description: The number of successful downloads in this time interval (15 minutes).

dlCBadDownloads.name: dlCBadDownloads
dlCBadDownloads.description: The number of failed downloads in this time interval (15 minutes).

dlCLongestTime.name: dlCLongestTime
dlCLongestTime.description: Longest time for any download, in seconds, in this time interval (15 minutes).

dlCLongestSize.name: dlCLongestSize
dlCLongestSize.description: Longest download size for any download, in bytes, in this time interval (15 minutes).

dlCCounterFlag.name: dlCCounterFlag
dlCCounterFlag.description: Turns software counters On or Off.

cpCNumEvents.name: cpCNumEvents
cpCNumEvents.description: Total number of events received by the active CP since this mode was activated.

cpCTrapsSent.name: cpCTrapsSent
cpCTrapsSent.description: Total number of traps sent by the active CP since this mode was activated.

cpCSNMPCmdsRcvd.name: cpCSNMPCmdsRcvd
cpCSNMPCmdsRcvd.description: Total number of SNMP commands received by the active CP since this mode was activated.

cpCCounterFlag.name: cpCCounterFlag
cpCCounterFlag.description: Turns software counters On or Off.

cpCCntrShelf.description: The shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 1 to 10. The system automatically determines the right value for this entry based on the value of the current active CP card.

cpCCntrSlot.name: cpCCntrSlot
cpCCntrSlot.description: The slot within the shelf the card is in. The system automatically determines the right value for this entry based on the value of the current active CP card.

cpCCntrType.name: cpCCntrType
cpCCntrType.description: The type of the software counter data in this row. The data is collected for the SPI data channels.

cpCTotPktSent.description: The number of data packets sent over the given data channel.

cpCTotPktRcvd.name: cpCTotPktRcvd
cpCTotPktRcvd.description: The number of data packets received over the given data channel.

cpCBadPktRcvd.name: cpCBadPktRcvd
cpCBadPktRcvd.description: The number of bad data packets received over the given data channel.

cpCTotBadTrans.name: cpCTotBadTrans
cpCTotBadTrans.description: The number of bad data transmissions over the given data channel.

cpCBytesSent.name: cpCBytesSent
cpCBytesSent.description: Total number of bytes sent over the given data channel.

cpCBytesRcvd.name: cpCBytesRcvd
cpCBytesRcvd.description: Total number of data bytes received over the given data channel.

cpCMsgsDlvrd.name: cpCMsgsDlvrd
cpCMsgsDlvrd.description: The number of complete messages delivered over the given data channel.

cpCBufAllocFail.description: Number of buffer allocation failures for the given data channel.

cpCEcbAllocFail.name: cpCEcbAllocFail

ccCSignalDetect.description: If set to true, signal is detected. If set to false, no signal is present.

ccCRefClock.name: ccCRefClock
ccCRefClock.description: The value of the reference clock in decimal notation. For a given value, like 1660, the actual value is 16.60-EN. In otherwords, assume a two digit decimal point, plus any appropriate scaling factor.

ccCClockDiv.name: ccCClockDiv
ccCClockDiv.description: The clock divisor. Values are 1250, 622 or 155 in the appropriate clock frequency scale.

mcmCIwmModulation.description: The frequency modulation for the IWM channel.

mcmCTemperature.name: mcmCTemperature
mcmCTemperature.description: The current temperature, or the operating temperature of the optical device.

mcmCIntensity.name: mcmCIntensity
mcmCIntensity.description: The intensity of the optical light.

mcmCSignalStrength.name: mcmCSignalStrength
mcmCSignalStrength.description: The current signal strength for the optical path.

mcmCLossOfLight.name: mcmCLossOfLight
mcmCLossOfLight.description: If set to true, no laser light is present. If set to false, no loss of light has occurred.

mcmCSignalDetect.name: mcmCSignalDetect
mcmCSignalDetect.description: If set to true, signal is detected. If set to false, no signal is present.

mcmCRefClock.name: mcmCRefClock
mcmCRefClock.description: The value of the reference clock in decimal notation. For a given value, like 1660, the actual value is 16.60-EN. In otherwords, assume a two digit decimal point, plus any appropriate scaling factor.

mcmCClockDiv.name: mcmCClockDiv
mcmCClockDiv.description: The clock divisor. Values are 1250, 622 or 155 in the appropriate clock frequency scale.

mcmPortCCntrEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

mcmPortCCntrCardLocation.name: mcmPortCCntrCardLocation
mcmPortCCntrCardLocation.description: Location of the MCM port. Valid values are: Local in the same chassis, or remote to this chassis

mcmPortCCntrCardShelf.name: mcmPortCCntrCardShelf
mcmPortCCntrCardShelf.description: The shelf the card is in. Valid values are: 2..3.

mcmPortCCntrCardSlot.name: mcmPortCCntrCardSlot
mcmPortCCntrCardSlot.description: The slot within the shelf the Module is in.

mcmPortCCntrASs.name: mcmPortCCntrASs
mcmPortCCntrASs.description: mcm port's ASs counter less than 15 mins.

mcmPortCCntrFEs.name: mcmPortCCntrFEs
mcmPortCCntrFEs.description: MCM port's FEs counter less than 15 mins.

mcmPortCCntrCRCErrs.name: mcmPortCCntrCRCErrs
mcmPortCCntrCRCErrs.description: MCM port's CRC errs counter less than 15 mins.

mcmPortCCntrSESs.name: mcmPortCCntrSESs
mcmPortCCntrSESs.description: mcm port's SESs counter less than 15 mins.

mcmPortCCntrSEFSs.name: mcmPortCCntrSEFSs
mcmPortCCntrSEFSs.description: MCM port's SEFSs counter less than 15 mins.

mcmPortCCntrUASs.name: mcmPortCCntrUASs
mcmPortCCntrUASs.description: MCM port's UASs counter less than 15 mins.

mcmPortCCntrLESs.name: mcmPortCCntrLESs
mcmPortCCntrLESs.description: MCM port's LESs counter less than 15 mins.

mcmPortCCntrBESs.name: mcmPortCCntrBESs
mcmPortCCntrBESs.description: MCM port's BESs counter less than 15 mins.

mcmPortCCntrDMs.name: mcmPortCCntrDMs
mcmPortCCntrDMs.description: MCM port's DMSs counter less than 15 mins.

mcmPortCCntrLCVs.name: mcmPortCCntrLCVs
mcmPortCCntrLCVs.description: MCM port's LCVs counter less than 15 mins.

rpsmCPerfSlot.name: rpsmCPerfSlot

rpsmCPerfState.description: The state of the rpsm card. The states are: online, offline, empty, loopback or diag.

rpsmCPerfStatus.name: rpsmCPerfStatus

rpsmCAvailTime.name: rpsmCAvailTime

rpsmCCounterFlag.name: rpsmCCounterFlag
rpsmCCounterFlag.description: Turns special condition software counters On or Off for this card. Default is off.

rsdmCCounterFlag.name: rsdmCCounterFlag
rsdmCCounterFlag.description: Turns special condition software counters On or Off for this card. Default is off.

rtdmCCounterFlag.description: Turns special condition software counters On or Off for this card. Default is off.

osamCNumEvents.description: Total number of events received for all osam's since this mode was started.

osamCPerfEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

osamCPerfShelf.name: osamCPerfShelf
osamCPerfShelf.description: The shelf number in which the module is plugged in.

osamCPerfSlot.name: osamCPerfSlot
osamCPerfSlot.description: The slot number in which the module is plugged in.

osamCPerfState.name: osamCPerfState
osamCPerfState.description: The current state of the module.

osamCPerfStatus.name: osamCPerfStatus
osamCPerfStatus.description: The current alarm status of the channel.

osamCPerfAvailTime.name: osamCPerfAvailTime
osamCPerfAvailTime.description: The number of seconds since the start of this mode that this module has been up and running.

osamCPerfErrFreeSecs.name: osamCPerfErrFreeSecs
osamCPerfErrFreeSecs.description: The number of seconds since the start of this mode that this module has been experienced any alarms.

osamCPerfCounterFlag.name: osamCPerfCounterFlag
osamCPerfCounterFlag.description: Turns osam special condition software counters on and off. Default is off.

rsmCNumEvents.name: rsmCNumEvents
rsmCNumEvents.description: Total number of all traps (events) generated by all RSMs' since this mode is started.

rsmCPerfTable.name: rsmCPerfTable
rsmCPerfTable.description: This table represents the information for performance data collected for each rsm card

rsmCPerfEntry.name: rsmCPerfEntry
rsmCPerfEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

rsmCPerfShelf.name: rsmCPerfShelf
rsmCPerfShelf.description: The shelf the card is in.

rsmCPerfSlot.name: rsmCPerfSlot
rsmCPerfSlot.description: The slot within the shelf the card is in.

rsmCPerfState.name: rsmCPerfState
rsmCPerfState.description: The state of the rsm card. The states are: online, offline, empty, loopback or diag.

rsmCPerfStatus.name: rsmCPerfStatus
rsmCPerfStatus.description: The status of the rsm card. This status represents the status of the rsm card and in general is different from the status of the system.

rsmCAvailTime.name: rsmCAvailTime

rsmCErrFreeSecs.name: rsmCErrFreeSecs

upsmCPerfStatus.description: The status of the upsm card. This status represents the status of the upsm card and in general is different from the status of the system.

upsmCAvailTime.name: upsmCAvailTime

upsmCErrFreeSecs.name: upsmCErrFreeSecs

upsmCCounterFlag.name: upsmCCounterFlag
upsmCCounterFlag.description: Turns special condition software counters On or Off for this card. Default is off.

eveTrapThreshold.name: eveTrapThreshold
eveTrapThreshold.description: Threshold before events of the same type are no longer sent. Default can be a number as small as 1.

eveNumEvents.name: eveNumEvents
eveNumEvents.description: Number of events logged in the table below. This counter is automatically set by the software.

eveLogTable.name: eveLogTable
eveLogTable.description: This table represents the information for the event log buffer. There are a maximum of 700 entries in the event log. The events are kept in a circular buffer fashion with eveSeqNum going from 1 to 9999.

eveLogEntry.name: eveLogEntry
eveLogEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

eveDateTime.name: eveDateTime
eveDateTime.description: The date and time of the event logged in the buffer

eveEventId.name: eveEventId
eveEventId.description: The event ID assigned to this event.

eveSeverity.name: eveSeverity
eveSeverity.description: The severity of this event. Could be critical, major, minor, or normal (informational).

eveSysStatus.name: eveSysStatus
eveSysStatus.description: The current status of the system. Could be critical, major, minor, or normal (informational).

eveSource.name: eveSource
eveSource.description: A five to seven tuple string composed of the following items: System Name:card type (MPM, OCMITU, OFCM, etc.). location (L for local, R[number] for remote with optional station number). shelf #. slot id[. port #][:link name(optional depending on card type)] [:ring name(optional)] [:path name(optional)]. When an event applies to all slots of the whole chassis, 0 will be displayed for both shelf and slot. Example: SystemInSunnyvale:OCMITU.L.1.6:ITU23

eveDescr.name: eveDescr
eveDescr.description: A string signifying the cause of the error in natural language (preferrably English) format.

eveTrap.name: eveTrap
eveTrap.description: If set to True, this event was sent as a trap. If set to False, this event was merely logged and not sent as a trap.

eveSeqNum.name: eveSeqNum
eveSeqNum.description: The unique sequence number for this event entry in the event log.

eveDeleteLog.name: eveDeleteLog
eveDeleteLog.description: If the value is reset, the event log table of the active cp is deleted - meaning all the log entries are flushed!!

eveLastEntryDateTime.name: eveLastEntryDateTime
eveLastEntryDateTime.description: Date and time stamp of the last event log entry. This provides quick access into the last event log entry.

eveHundredthEntryDateTime.name: eveHundredthEntryDateTime
eveHundredthEntryDateTime.description: Date and time stamp of the most recent 100th event log entry. This provides quick access into retrieving the most recent 100 event log entries. If less than 100 entries exist in the event log, the return value contains all zeroes.

eveTwoHundredthEntryDateTime.name: eveTwoHundredthEntryDateTime
eveTwoHundredthEntryDateTime.description: Date and time stamp of the most recent 200th event log entry. This provides quick access into retrieving the most recent 200 event log entries. If less than 200 entries exist in the event log, the return value contains all zeroes.

eveThreeHundredthEntryDateTime.name: eveThreeHundredthEntryDateTime
eveThreeHundredthEntryDateTime.description: Date and time stamp of the most recent 300th event log entry. This provides quick access into retrieving the most recent 300 event log entries. If less than 300 entries exist in the event log, the return value contains all zeroes.

eveFourHundredthEntryDateTime.name: eveFourHundredthEntryDateTime
eveFourHundredthEntryDateTime.description: Date and time stamp of the most recent 400th event log entry. This provides quick access into retrieving the most recent 400 event log entries. If less than 400 entries exist in the event log, the return value contains all zeroes.

eveFiveHundredthEntryDateTime.name: eveFiveHundredthEntryDateTime
eveFiveHundredthEntryDateTime.description: Date and time stamp of the most recent 500th event log entry. This provides quick access into retrieving the most recent 500 event log entries. If less than 500 entries exist in the event log, the return value contains all zeroes.

eveSixHundredthEntryDateTime.name: eveSixHundredthEntryDateTime
eveSixHundredthEntryDateTime.description: Date and time stamp of the most recent 600th event log entry. This provides quick access into retrieving the most recent 600 event log entries. If less than 600 entries exist in the event log, the return value contains all zeroes.

eveSevenHundredthEntryDateTime.name: eveSevenHundredthEntryDateTime
eveSevenHundredthEntryDateTime.description: Date and time stamp of the most recent 700th event log entry. This provides quick access into retrieving the most recent 700 event log entries. If less than 700 entries exist in the event log, the return value contains all zeroes.

eveEightHundredthEntryDateTime.name: eveEightHundredthEntryDateTime
eveEightHundredthEntryDateTime.description: Date and time stamp of the most recent 800th event log entry. This provides quick access into retrieving the most recent 800 event log entries. If less than 800 entries exist in the event log, the return value contains all zeroes.

eveNineHundredthEntryDateTime.name: eveNineHundredthEntryDateTime
eveNineHundredthEntryDateTime.description: Date and time stamp of the most recent 900th event log entry. This provides quick access into retrieving the most recent 900 event log entries. If less than 900 entries exist in the event log, the return value contains all zeroes.

usrNumLogs.name: usrNumLogs
usrNumLogs.description: Number of user events logged in the table below. This counter is automatically set by the software.

usrLogTable.name: usrLogTable
usrLogTable.description: This table represents the information for user event log buffer

usrLogEntry.name: usrLogEntry
usrLogEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

usrDateTime.name: usrDateTime
usrDateTime.description: The date and time of the event logged in the buffer

usrLogonId.name: usrLogonId
usrLogonId.description: The Logon ID of the user causing this event to be logged.

usrTarget.name: usrTarget
usrTarget.description: A four tuple string composed of the following items: location (remote or local), type (cp, cc, mux or ps), shelf, and slot id. The tuples are separated by comma. Example: local,cp,b,1. This column identifies which subsystem was affected by the user action.

usrLogDescr.name: usrLogDescr
usrLogDescr.description: A string signifying the action logged in natural language (preferrably English) format.

usrTrap.name: usrTrap
usrTrap.description: If set to True, this user event was sent as a trap. If set to False, this event was merely logged and not sent as a trap.

alarmNumEvents.name: alarmNumEvents
alarmNumEvents.description: Number of alarms logged in the table below. This counter is automatically set by the software. The max is 300 entries.

alarmLogTable.name: alarmLogTable
alarmLogTable.description: This table represents the information for the alarm log buffer

alarmLogEntry.name: alarmLogEntry
alarmLogEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

alarmFirstDateTime.name: alarmFirstDateTime
alarmFirstDateTime.description: The date and time for the first alarm occurrence.

alarmTag.name: alarmTag
alarmTag.description: A unique tag used to identify the alarm entry.

alarmLastDateTime.name: alarmLastDateTime
alarmLastDateTime.description: The date and time for the most recent alarm occurrence. If this is the first time occurrence, it would be same as alarmFirstDateTime.

alarmEventId.name: alarmEventId
alarmEventId.description: The event ID assigned to this alarm.

alarmSeverity.name: alarmSeverity
alarmSeverity.description: The severity of this alarm. Could be critical, major, or minor.

alarmSource.name: alarmSource
alarmSource.description: A five to seven tuple string composed of the following items: System Name:card type (MPM, OCMITU, OFCM, etc.). location (L for local, R[number] for remote with optional station number). shelf #. slot id[. port #][:link name(optional depending on card type)][:ring name (optional)] [:pathname(optional)]. When an event applies to all slots of the whole chassis, 0 will be displayed for both shelf and slot. Example: SystemInSunnyvale:OCMITU.L.1.6:ITU23

alarmDescr.name: alarmDescr
alarmDescr.description: A string signifying the cause of the error in natural language (preferrably English) format.

alarmCnt.name: alarmCnt
alarmCnt.description: Number of times alarm has occurred(from the same source).

alarmAck.name: alarmAck
alarmAck.description: Acknowledge or unacknowledge the active alarm. Ack will remove its contribution to the external dry contact alarm closure. Default is unacknowledged.

alarmClear.name: alarmClear
alarmClear.description: An action to clear the alarm from the alarm log. If alarm persists, another alarm will be sent. A GET operation would always return other(1).

alarmLastChange.name: alarmLastChange
alarmLastChange.description: Time ticks in microseconds of when the last change was made to the alarm log. This includes ack/unack, clear, and alarm addition/deletion.

diagModeNum.name: diagModeNum
diagModeNum.description: Number of cards in diagnostics mode in the table below. This counter is automatically set by the software.

diagModeTable.name: diagModeTable
diagModeTable.description: This table represents the information for each card in diagnostics mode.

diagModeEntry.name: diagModeEntry
diagModeEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

diagLocation.name: diagLocation
diagLocation.description: The location of the card: local or remote

diagShelf.name: diagShelf
diagShelf.description: The shelf in which the card is located.

diagSlot.name: diagSlot
diagSlot.description: The card slot in which the card is located.

diagSetMode.name: diagSetMode
diagSetMode.description: If on, the card will be in diagnostics mode. If off, the card comes out of diagnostics mode.

diagTestNum.name: diagTestNum
diagTestNum.description: Number of built-in diagnostics tests in the table below.

diagTestTable.name: diagTestTable
diagTestTable.description: This table represents the information for each built-in diagnostics test.

diagTestEntry.name: diagTestEntry
diagTestEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

diagTestId.name: diagTestId
diagTestId.description: The name of the built-in diagnostics test.

diagTLocation.name: diagTLocation
diagTLocation.description: The location of the card to run the test on

diagTShelf.name: diagTShelf
diagTShelf.description: The shelf in which the card is located.

diagTSlot.name: diagTSlot
diagTSlot.description: The card slot in which the card is located.

diagParam1.name: diagParam1
diagParam1.description: The first parameter, if any to pass to the built-in test module. This parameter may be NULL to signify no run-time parameters. If there is a parameter in, any data type, it should be passed as a String equivalent.

diagParam2.name: diagParam2
diagParam2.description: The second parameter, if any to pass to the built-in test module. This parameter may be NULL to signify no more run-time parameters. If there is a parameter in any data type, it should be passed as a String equivalent.

diagParam3.name: diagParam3
diagParam3.description: The third parameter, if any to pass to the built-in test module. This parameter may be NULL to signify no more run-time parameters. If there is a parameter in any data type, it should be passed as a String equivalent.

diagTSetMode.name: diagTSetMode
diagTSetMode.description: If on, the given test will be run on the given card. The value off has no effect in this case and is ignored.

mcmescSelfTestTable.name: mcmescSelfTestTable
mcmescSelfTestTable.description: This table represents the self-test results for mcmesc link port.

mcmescSelfTestEntry.name: mcmescSelfTestEntry
mcmescSelfTestEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

mcmescSelfTestLocation.name: mcmescSelfTestLocation
mcmescSelfTestLocation.description: The location of the card: local or remote. The self test is applicable to local mcmesc only.

mcmescSelfTestShelf.name: mcmescSelfTestShelf
mcmescSelfTestShelf.description: The shelf in which the card is located.

mcmescSelfTestSlot.name: mcmescSelfTestSlot
mcmescSelfTestSlot.description: The card slot in which the card is located.

mcmescSelfTestStart.name: mcmescSelfTestStart
mcmescSelfTestStart.description: Initiate a self-test. A get on this will always return an other. Any outstanding loopbacks will be turned off before starting self-test.

mcmescSelfTestResult.name: mcmescSelfTestResult
mcmescSelfTestResult.description: Indicate an overall result of the latest self-test. The value inprogress(3) will be given if a self-test is in progress. The table mcmescLinkSelfTestResult and mcmescPortSelfTestResult show the detail result of each individual test item.

mcmescSelfTestSeqNum.name: mcmescSelfTestSeqNum
mcmescSelfTestSeqNum.description: Indicate a sequece number associated with the latest complete self test. The sring of inprogress will be given if a self-test is in progress. The table mcmescLinkSelfTestResult and mcmescPortSelfTestResult show the detail result of each individual test item.

mcmescSelfTestTimeStamp.name: mcmescSelfTestTimeStamp
mcmescSelfTestTimeStamp.description: Indicate the time stamp associated with the latest complete self test. The value inprogress(3) will be given if a self-test is in progress. The table mcmescLinkSelfTestResult and mcmescPortSelfTestResult show the detail result of each individual test item.

mcmescLinkSelfTestResultTable.name: mcmescLinkSelfTestResultTable
mcmescLinkSelfTestResultTable.description: This table represents the self-test results for mcmesc link port.

mcmescLinkSelfTestResultEntry.name: mcmescLinkSelfTestResultEntry
mcmescLinkSelfTestResultEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

mcmescLinkSelfTestLocation.name: mcmescLinkSelfTestLocation
mcmescLinkSelfTestLocation.description: The location of the card: local or remote. The self test is applicable to local mcmesc only.

mcmescLinkSelfTestShelf.name: mcmescLinkSelfTestShelf
mcmescLinkSelfTestShelf.description: The shelf in which the card is located.

mcmescLinkSelfTestSlot.name: mcmescLinkSelfTestSlot
mcmescLinkSelfTestSlot.description: The card slot in which the card is located.

mcmescLinkSelfTestTxI2c.name: mcmescLinkSelfTestTxI2c
mcmescLinkSelfTestTxI2c.description: Indicate the link port's Tx I2C self-test result. The value inprogress(3) will be given if a self-test is in progress.

mcmescLinkSelfTestCdrI2c.name: mcmescLinkSelfTestCdrI2c
mcmescLinkSelfTestCdrI2c.description: Indicate the link port's CDR I2C self-test result. The value inprogress(3) will be given if a self-test is in progress.

mcmescLinkSelfTestDataPath.name: mcmescLinkSelfTestDataPath
mcmescLinkSelfTestDataPath.description: Indicate the link port's data path self-test result. The value inprogress(3) will be given if a self-test is in progress.

mcmescPortSelfTestResultTable.name: mcmescPortSelfTestResultTable
mcmescPortSelfTestResultTable.description: This table represents the self-test results for mcmesc CPE port.

mcmescPortSelfTestResultEntry.name: mcmescPortSelfTestResultEntry
mcmescPortSelfTestResultEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

mcmescPortSelfTestLocation.name: mcmescPortSelfTestLocation
mcmescPortSelfTestLocation.description: The location of the card: local or remote. The self test is applicable to local mcmesc only.

mcmescPortSelfTestShelf.name: mcmescPortSelfTestShelf
mcmescPortSelfTestShelf.description: The shelf in which the card is located.

mcmescPortSelfTestSlot.name: mcmescPortSelfTestSlot

mcmescPortSelfTestTxI2c.name: mcmescPortSelfTestTxI2c
mcmescPortSelfTestTxI2c.description: Indicate the CPE port's Tx I2C self-test result. The value inprogress(3) will be given if a self-test is in progress.

mcmescPortSelfTestCdrI2c.name: mcmescPortSelfTestCdrI2c

mcmescPortSelfTestTxDataPath.name: mcmescPortSelfTestTxDataPath
mcmescPortSelfTestTxDataPath.description: Indicate the CPE port's Tx data path self-test result. The value inprogress(3) will be given if a self-test is in progress.

mcmescPortSelfTestRxDataPath.name: mcmescPortSelfTestRxDataPath
mcmescPortSelfTestRxDataPath.description: Indicate the CPE port's Rx data path self-test result. The value inprogress(3) will be given if a self-test is in progress.

usrNumUsers.name: usrNumUsers
usrNumUsers.description: Number of user Logons in the table below. This counter is automatically set by the software.

usrSecTable.name: usrSecTable
usrSecTable.description: This table represents the information for each user logon entry.

usrSecEntry.name: usrSecEntry
usrSecEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

usrSecLogonId.name: usrSecLogonId
usrSecLogonId.description: The unique logon ID assigned to each user. This field should only be written by users that are in the right security role.

usrSecPasswd.name: usrSecPasswd
usrSecPasswd.description: The hashed password for each unique logon ID. To turn the user account off, typically the password is set to some fixed value. Fixed passwords are not accepted as valid passwords. Since this field is one-way hashed, it can be safely read without compromising the security of the system.

usrSecRole.name: usrSecRole
usrSecRole.description: The role associated with each user logon ID. This is an index into the system role(s) table.

usrSecFullName.name: usrSecFullName
usrSecFullName.description: The full name of the user associated with each unique logon ID.

usrSecActDateTime.name: usrSecActDateTime
usrSecActDateTime.description: The Time & Date of the user account activation.

usrSecLastDateTime.name: usrSecLastDateTime
usrSecLastDateTime.description: The Time & Date of the last user logon to the system

usrSecSetLastDateTime.name: usrSecSetLastDateTime
usrSecSetLastDateTime.description: An action to set the Time & Date of the last user logon to the current systemtime.

secNumRoles.name: secNumRoles
secNumRoles.description: Number of system security roles in the table below. This counter is automatically set by the software.

secRoleTable.name: secRoleTable
secRoleTable.description: This table represents the information for each system security role entry.

secRoleEntry.name: secRoleEntry
secRoleEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

secRole.name: secRole
secRole.description: Each row in this table defines a unique security role.

secRoleDescr.name: secRoleDescr
secRoleDescr.description: The full narrated description of each security Role.

secNumGroups.name: secNumGroups
secNumGroups.description: Number of entity groups in the table below. This counter is automatically set by the software.

secGroupTable.name: secGroupTable
secGroupTable.description: This table represents the information for each entity group entry.

secGroupEntry.name: secGroupEntry
secGroupEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

secGroup.name: secGroup
secGroup.description: Each row in this table defines a grouping of entities or elements from the MIB.

secGroupRole.name: secGroupRole
secGroupRole.description: The containment of this group within a security role. Under the given schema, each Role may have zero or more entity groups. Given an entity group, it may have been contained within one or more roles.

secNumElements.name: secNumElements
secNumElements.description: Number of elements or entities in the table below. This counter is automatically set by the software.

secElementTable.name: secElementTable
secElementTable.description: This table represents the information for each entity or element in the MIB.

secElementEntry.name: secElementEntry
secElementEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

secElement.name: secElement
secElement.description: Each row in this table defines an element or entity from the MIB.

secElementAccess.name: secElementAccess
secElementAccess.description: The original access mode for this element from the MIB.

secElementOID.name: secElementOID
secElementOID.description: The original SNMP OID for this element from the MIB.

secElementType.name: secElementType
secElementType.description: The original type for this element from the MIB.

secElementParent.name: secElementParent
secElementParent.description: The original parent name for this element from the MIB. The parent is either a table or a subgroup.

secNumElmntGrp.name: secNumElmntGrp
secNumElmntGrp.description: Number of element-to-group mappings in the table below. This counter is automatically set by the software.

secElmntGrpTable.name: secElmntGrpTable
secElmntGrpTable.description: This table represents the information for each element-to-group mapping.

secElmntGrpEntry.name: secElmntGrpEntry
secElmntGrpEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

elmntName.name: elmntName
elmntName.description: Each row in this table defines a mapping of elements to groups. This column is an index into the secElementTable.

grpName.name: grpName
grpName.description: Each row in this table defines a mapping of elements to groups. This column is an index into the secGroupTable.

elmntGrpAccess.name: elmntGrpAccess
elmntGrpAccess.description: The access mode assigned to each element/group entry. Under the given schema, each group may have zero or more MIB elements. Given an element, it may have been contained within one or more groups. The access mode specified here defines what is the granted access mode to the named element contained in this group. Note, the granted access right can never exceed that of the actual MIB access privilege.

radiusAuthOrder.name: radiusAuthOrder
radiusAuthOrder.description: The authentication order used when validating a user login id and password.

radiusDefaultRealm.name: radiusDefaultRealm
radiusDefaultRealm.description: Default realm used for radius authentication. This realm is not used for local authentication.

radiusTimeout.name: radiusTimeout
radiusTimeout.description: Timeout when sending an authentication request to a radius server.

radiusRetries.name: radiusRetries
radiusRetries.description: Number of times to resend requests when a timeout occurs.

radiusSecEntry.name: radiusSecEntry
radiusSecEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

radiusServerIndex.name: radiusServerIndex
radiusServerIndex.description: Index into the radius server table. This index also specifies the server order used for sending authentication requests.

radiusServerAddress.name: radiusServerAddress
radiusServerAddress.description: IP address of the radius server. Setting the address to 0 will delete the server entry.

radiusServerPort.name: radiusServerPort
radiusServerPort.description: Radius port used for authentication requests.

radiusAddServer.name: radiusAddServer
radiusAddServer.description: Add server to the server table. Servers are added to the first available entry in the server table. To add a server provide server IP address, radius port, and shared secret in the format '<ip address>,<port>, <secret>'. All fields are required. a get on this element will return '0,0,0'.

sshMode.name: sshMode
sshMode.description: Enables or disables the SSH server. Enabling SSH will disable the built in telnet server. Disabling SSH will enable the telnet server.

sshKeySize.name: sshKeySize
sshKeySize.description: The size (in bits) of the DSS key to generate. Key size must be a multiple of 8 and between 512 and 1024 bits.

sshMaxSessions.name: sshMaxSessions
sshMaxSessions.description: The maximum number of SSH sessions that can be active at one time. Setting this element will also affect the number of telnet sessions that can be active at a time.

sshGenKey.name: sshGenKey
sshGenKey.description: Setting this element to genDssKey(2) will cause a new DSS key to be generated. The process of generating a new key can take some time (several minutes) and may cause significant system slowdown until the process is complete. Reading this element will always return other(1).

acctCPTable.name: acctCPTable
acctCPTable.description: This table represents the information for each system accounting data maintained for each CP.

acctCPEntry.name: acctCPEntry
acctCPEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

acctCPShelf.name: acctCPShelf
acctCPShelf.description: The shelf in which the given CP card is placed.

acctCPSlot.name: acctCPSlot
acctCPSlot.description: The slot in which the given CP card is placed.

acctCPDsgnAct.name: acctCPDsgnAct
acctCPDsgnAct.description: The total time this CP has been designated Active

acctCPDsgnStdby.name: acctCPDsgnStdby
acctCPDsgnStdby.description: The total time this CP has been designated Standby

acctCPActive.name: acctCPActive
acctCPActive.description: The total time this CP has actually been the primary

acctCPStandby.name: acctCPStandby
acctCPStandby.description: The total time this CP has actually been the standby

acctCPUpTime.name: acctCPUpTime
acctCPUpTime.description: The total time since this CP has been commissioned

acctCPUnAvail.name: acctCPUnAvail
acctCPUnAvail.description: The total time this CP has not been available due to an alarm, diag testing or being put offline

acctCPResetCntrs.name: acctCPResetCntrs
acctCPResetCntrs.description: If reset, the CP accounting counters will be reset to 0. A get on this will always return other.

acctCCTable.name: acctCCTable
acctCCTable.description: This table represents the information for each system accounting data maintained for each CC.

acctCCEntry.name: acctCCEntry
acctCCEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

acctCCLocation.name: acctCCLocation
acctCCLocation.description: The location of the CC card: local or remote.

acctCCShelf.name: acctCCShelf
acctCCShelf.description: The shelf in which the given CC card is placed.

acctCCSlot.name: acctCCSlot
acctCCSlot.description: The slot in which the given CC card is placed.

acctCCUpTime.name: acctCCUpTime
acctCCUpTime.description: The total time since this CC has been commissioned

acctCCUnAvail.name: acctCCUnAvail
acctCCUnAvail.description: The total time this CC has not been available due to an alarm, diag testing or being put offline

acctCCResetCntrs.name: acctCCResetCntrs
acctCCResetCntrs.description: If reset, the CC accounting counters will be reset to 0. A get on this will always return other.

acctmcmTable.name: acctmcmTable
acctmcmTable.description: This table represents the information for each system accounting data maintained for each MCMT1/MCME1.

acctmcmEntry.name: acctmcmEntry
acctmcmEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

acctmcmLocation.name: acctmcmLocation
acctmcmLocation.description: The location of the MCMT1/MCME1 card: local or remote.

acctmcmShelf.name: acctmcmShelf
acctmcmShelf.description: The shelf in which the given MCMT1/MCME1 card is placed.

acctmcmSlot.name: acctmcmSlot
acctmcmSlot.description: The slot in which the given MCMT1/MCME1 card is placed.

acctmcmUpTime.name: acctmcmUpTime
acctmcmUpTime.description: The total time since this MCMT1/MCME1 has been commissioned

acctmcmUnAvail.name: acctmcmUnAvail
acctmcmUnAvail.description: The total time this MCMT1/MCME1 has not been available due to an alarm, diag testing or being put offline

acctmcmResetCntrs.name: acctmcmResetCntrs
acctmcmResetCntrs.description: If reset, the MCMT1/MCME1 accounting counters will be reset to 0. A get on this will always return other.

acctmcmescTable.name: acctmcmescTable
acctmcmescTable.description: This table represents the information for each system accounting data maintained for each MCMESC.

acctmcmescEntry.name: acctmcmescEntry
acctmcmescEntry.description: Specifies the index for each row in the table below

acctmcmescLocation.name: acctmcmescLocation
acctmcmescLocation.description: The location of the MCMESC card: local or remote.

acctmcmescShelf.name: acctmcmescShelf
acctmcmescShelf.description: The shelf in which the given MCMESC card is placed.

acctmcmescSlot.name: acctmcmescSlot
acctmcmescSlot.description: The slot in which the given MCMESC card is placed.

acctmcmescUpTime.name: acctmcmescUpTime
acctmcmescUpTime.description: The total time since this MCMESC has been commissioned.

acctmcmescUnAvail.name: acctmcmescUnAvail
acctmcmescUnAvail.description: The total time this MCMESC has not been available due to an alarm, diag testing or being put offline.

acctmcmescResetCntrs.name: acctmcmescResetCntrs
acctmcmescResetCntrs.description: If reset, the MCMESC accounting counters will be reset to 0. A get on this will always return other.

luxNGenericTrap.name: luxNGenericTrap
luxNGenericTrap.description: This is a generic trap identifying an event for a given event source. The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. In the case of the power supply and fan, the shelf number is set to 0. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. The severity or trap type may be: critical, major, minor, or normal. For a given event severity, there is a corresponding system status, not necessarily the same as the event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

luxNVoadmDetectorFailureTrap.name: luxNVoadmDetectorFailureTrap
luxNVoadmDetectorFailureTrap.description: This trap is sent when a failure is detected on the VOADM power monitor. The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. In the case of the power supply and fan, the shelf number is set to 0. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. The severity or trap type may be: critical, major, minor, or normal. For a given event severity, there is a corresponding system status, not necessarily the same as the event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

luxNVoadmDetectorFailureResolvedTrap.name: luxNVoadmDetectorFailureResolvedTrap
luxNVoadmDetectorFailureResolvedTrap.description: This trap is sent when a failure on the VOADM power monitor has been resolved. The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. In the case of the power supply and fan, the shelf number is set to 0. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. The severity or trap type may be: critical, major, minor, or normal. For a given event severity, there is a corresponding system status, not necessarily the same as the event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

luxNVoadmOutofRangeTrap.name: luxNVoadmOutofRangeTrap
luxNVoadmOutofRangeTrap.description: This trap is sent when the user configured settings for a VOADM would force the power levels to be outside of allowed operating ranges for the current link conditions. The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. In the case of the power supply and fan, the shelf number is set to 0. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. The severity or trap type may be: critical, major, minor, or normal. For a given event severity, there is a corresponding system status, not necessarily the same as the event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

luxNVoadmOutofRangeResolvedTrap.name: luxNVoadmOutofRangeResolvedTrap
luxNVoadmOutofRangeResolvedTrap.description: This trap is sent when an existing VOADM out of range condition is resolved. The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. In the case of the power supply and fan, the shelf number is set to 0. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. The severity or trap type may be: critical, major, minor, or normal. For a given event severity, there is a corresponding system status, not necessarily the same as the event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

In the case of the power supply and fan, the shelf number is set to 0. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. luxNberHighThresholdExceeded.name: luxNberHighThresholdExceeded
luxNberHighThresholdExceeded.description: This trap is sent upon detecting that MCMESC's BER high threshold is exceeds. The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. The port number 1 to 12 is applicable to CPE ports, a NULL port number indicates the link. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. The severity or trap type may be: critical, major, minor, or normal. For a given event severity, there is a corresponding system status, not necessarily the same as the event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

luxNberHighThresholdExceededNormal.name: luxNberHighThresholdExceededNormal
luxNberHighThresholdExceededNormal.description: This trap is sent upon detecting that MCMESC's BER high threshold is not exceeded. The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. The port number 1 to 12 is applicable to CPE ports, a NULL port number indicates the link. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. The severity or trap type may be: critical, major, minor, or normal. For a given event severity, there is a corresponding system status, not necessarily the same as the event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. The port number 1 to 12 is applicable to CPE ports, a NULL port number indicates the link. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. luxNSNMPKeepalive.name: luxNSNMPKeepalive
luxNSNMPKeepalive.description: This trap is sent out periodicly by the MPM when SNMP keep alive functionality is enabled.

luxNSNMPKeepalivesEnabled.name: luxNSNMPKeepalivesEnabled
luxNSNMPKeepalivesEnabled.description: This trap is sent upon SNMP keep alive functionality being enabled

luxNSNMPKeepalivesDisabled.name: luxNSNMPKeepalivesDisabled
luxNSNMPKeepalivesDisabled.description: This trap is sent upon SNMP keep alive functionality being disabled

luxNSNMPKeepaliveIntervalChanged.name: luxNSNMPKeepaliveIntervalChanged
luxNSNMPKeepaliveIntervalChanged.description: This trap is sent when the SNMP keep alive interval is modified

luxNTelnetClientEnabled.name: luxNTelnetClientEnabled
luxNTelnetClientEnabled.description: Telnet client has been enabled for active telnet sessions

luxNTelnetClientDisabled.name: luxNTelnetClientDisabled
luxNTelnetClientDisabled.description: Telnet client has been disabled for active telnet sessions

The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. luxNlossOfLightResolvedTrap.name: luxNlossOfLightResolvedTrap

The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. In the case of the power supply and fan, the shelf number is set to 0. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

For OCM/MCMT1/MCME1, it indicates that the link between two optically connected channel cards is down. The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. In the case of the power supply and fan, the shelf number is set to 0. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. luxNvoadmMuxSetPointOutOfRange.name: luxNvoadmMuxSetPointOutOfRange
luxNvoadmMuxSetPointOutOfRange.description: This trap is sent when a VOADM module has detected that the recently configured mux set point value would bring down the fibre if applied. The set point value is rejected and the MPM and module returns to the previously configured mux set point. The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. In the case of the power supply and fan, the shelf number is set to 0. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. The severity or trap type may be: critical, major, minor, or normal. For a given event severity, there is a corresponding system status, not necessarily the same as the event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

luxNvoadmDemuxForceConfig.name: luxNvoadmDemuxForceConfig
luxNvoadmDemuxForceConfig.description: This trap is sent when a VOADM module forces its Demux configuration into fixed power mode. Forcing the Demux mode to fixed power mode can only occur when the Demux ports are configured for fixed attentuation mode and network conditions change sufficently that the current configuration may cause damage to the laser. The source is a 4 or 5 tuple specifying the type, location, shelf, slot ID, and optionally the port number of the source of the event. In the case of the power supply and fan, the shelf number is set to 0. Each event has an unique event ID. It also has a preset event severity. The severity or trap type may be: critical, major, minor, or normal. For a given event severity, there is a corresponding system status, not necessarily the same as the event severity. For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.

For each reported trap, the IP address of the CP responsible for sending this trap is also included in the trap structure.
